Putin signals readiness for a long war and promises 'new success'
subhed: During an annual TV address on Friday, December 19, the Russian leader showed no signs of changing course on Russia's war on Ukraine, claiming that 'the ball is entirely in the court of Ukraine and its European sponsors.'

In Paris, tour buses spark growing debate over the impact of tourism
subhed: As coach operators complain about increasing difficulties navigating and parking in the French capital, City Hall says it wants fewer tour buses in the city. But so far, there are no real alternatives.

title: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
subhed: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.

title: Mbappé equals Ronaldo's 59-goal club record as Real Madrid beat Sevilla
subhed: Kylian Mbappé matched Cristiano Ronaldo's Real Madrid record for goals in a calendar year by netting his 59th from the penalty spot as Madrid secured a 2-0 La Liga win over Sevilla.

title: More than 1.7 million French schoolchildren face high 'pesticide pressure' levels
subhed: Le Monde and a team of 10 scientists have established a barometer to measure the potential pesticide exposure level around every French school.

title: 'Emily in Paris,' season 5, on Netflix: Her weekend in Rome
A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhed: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: 'The New Yorker at 100': A certain idea of journalism, narrated by Julianne Moore
subhed: Marshall Curry's documentary takes viewers behind the scenes of the iconic American weekly magazine, which continues to thrive in the modern era.

title: In Paris, the number of homeless living in outdoor camps continues to rise
subhed: Outreach teams counted 663 tents in the main encampment areas of the French capital at the end of November, representing between 985 and 1,723 people. The rise is driven by a reduction in available shelter spaces and tighter restrictions on residency permits.
